title: The Stability of Noncommutative Scalar Solitons
abstract: We determine the stability conditions for a radially symmetric noncommutative scalar soliton at finite noncommutivity parameter $\theta$. We find an intriguing relationship between the stability and existence conditions for all level-1 solutions, in that they all have nearly-vanishing stability eigenvalues at critical $\theta m^2$. The stability or non-stability of the system may then be determined entirely by the $\phi^3$ coefficient in the potential. For higher-level solutions we find an ambiguity in extrapolating solutions to finite $\theta$ which prevents us from making any general statements. For these stability may be determined by comparing the fluctuation eigenvalues to critical values which we calculate.
